Water has a high specific heat capacity, which means it can absorb or release large amounts of heat with little change in its own temperature. This property makes water an excellent coolant and is also why coastal regions have moderate climates.

options: Because water heats and cools slowly

The Kelvin scale is used in scientific research because it begins at absolute zero, the point where all molecular motion stops. It avoids negative temperatures, making it ideal for thermodynamic calculations.
